00025 bool seek_non_comment_line(std::ifstream& fs, std::string& line)
00026 {
00027         while (!fs.bad() && !fs.eof())
00028         {
00029                 std::getline(fs, line);
00030 
00031                 /* Allows for whitespace preceding the line comment's "#" indicator */
00032                 u32 indicator_position = line.find_first_not_of(" \t");
00033                 if ((indicator_position != std::string::npos && line[indicator_position] == '#') || (line == ""))
00034                 {
00035                         /* This line is a comment (or is blank); disregard it. */
00036                         continue;
00037                 }
00038                 else
00039                 {
00040                         /* We found a value whose first character is not "#" (or whitespace) */
00041                         return true;
00042                 }
00043         }
00044 
00045         /* We'll only get here if bad input (like EOF) occurs before we were
00046          * expecting it to.  Erase "line" so caller doesn't get garbage values.
00047          */
00048         line = "";
00049         return false;
00050 }

00052 
00066 bool name_and_value(const std::string& str, std::string& name, std::vector<std::string>& manyValues)
00067 {
00068         /* This should split everything to the left of "=" into one token and
00069          * everything to the right into a second.
00070          */
00071         std::vector<std::string> tokens = tokenize(str, "=");
00072         if (tokens.size() != 2)
00073         {
00074                 /* We must not have found a "=", or we found more than one (oops).
00075                  */
00076 
00077                 /* Print some debugging info */
00078                 u32 size = tokens.size();
00079                 for (u32 i = 0; i < size; ++i)
00080                 {
00081                         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL1, std::cout, "Token %d: \"%s\"\n", i, tokens[i].c_str());
00082                 }
00083 
00084                 return false;
00085         }
00086 
00087         /* Strip out whitespace surrounding "name" and return the cleaned-up string
00088          * to the caller.
00089          */
00090         std::vector<std::string> nameTokens = tokenize(tokens[0], " \t");
00091         name = nameTokens[0];
00092         u32 nameTokensSize = nameTokens.size();
00093         for (u32 i = 1; i < nameTokensSize; ++i)
00094         {
00095                 name = name + " " + nameTokens[i];
00096         }
00097 
00098         /* For the "values", we need to do this in stages.
00099          * Stage 1: Separate by commas
00100          * Stage 2: Remove whitespace around each tokenized string
00101          * Stage 3: Return the cleaned-up vector to the caller
00102          */
00103 
00104         // Stage 1: commas
00105         std::vector<std::string> valueTokens = tokenize(tokens[1], ",");
00106         u32 valueTokensSize = valueTokens.size();
00107         for (u32 i = 0; i < valueTokensSize; ++i)
00108         {
00109                 // Stage 2: whitespace
00110                 std::vector<std::string> cleaned = tokenize(valueTokens[i], " \t");
00111                 std::string cleanedString = cleaned[0];
00112                 u32 cleanedSize = cleaned.size();
00113                 for (u32 cleanIndex = 1; cleanIndex < cleanedSize; ++cleanIndex)
00114                 {
00115                         cleanedString = cleanedString + " " + cleaned[cleanIndex];
00116                 }
00117 
00118                 // Stage 3: return cleaned-up string to "value" vector
00119                 if ("" != cleanedString)
00120                 {
00121                         manyValues.push_back(cleanedString);
00122                 }
00123         }
00124 
00125         u32 valueSize = manyValues.size();
00126         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL1, std::cout, "\tName: \"%s\"\n", name.c_str());
00127         for (u32 i = 0; i < valueSize; ++i)
00128         {
00129                 Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL1, std::cout, "\t\tValue %d: \"%s\"\n", i, manyValues[i].c_str());
00130         }
00131 
00132     return true;
00133 }

00136 //Function from http://www.digitalpeer.com/id/simple
00137 std::vector<std::string> tokenize(const std::string& str, const std::string& delimiters)
00138 {
00139         std::vector<std::string> tokens;
00140 
00141         // skip delimiters at beginning.
00142         std::string::size_type lastPos = str.find_first_not_of(delimiters, 0);
00143 
00144         // find first "non-delimiter".
00145         std::string::size_type pos = str.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00146 
00147         while (std::string::npos != pos || std::string::npos != lastPos)
00148         {
00149                 // found a token, add it to the vector.
00150                 std::string temp = str.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos);
00151                 if ("" != temp)
00152                 {
00153                         tokens.push_back(temp);
00154                 }
00155 
00156                 // skip delimiters.  Note the "not_of"
00157                 lastPos = str.find_first_not_of(delimiters, pos);
00158 
00159                 // find next "non-delimiter"
00160                 pos = str.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00161         }
00162 
00163         return tokens;
00164 }
00165 
00166 
00167 std::string next_token(const std::string& str, const std::string& delimiters, std::string::size_type& pos)
00168 {
00169         // skip delimiters at beginning.
00170         std::string::size_type lastPos = str.find_first_not_of(delimiters, pos);
00171 
00172         // find first "non-delimiter".
00173         pos = str.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00174 
00175         if (std::string::npos != pos || std::string::npos != lastPos)
00176         {
00177                 // found a token, return it
00178                 return str.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos);
00179         }
00180 
00181         return "";
00182 }
